Source: litt. ‘they-go-toward-each-other’ (comparable form in Nivacle’s sister langue: ikwetxuɬ (Gerzenstein 1999)

litt. ‘there-is-one + it-ends-with-it’; alternatives: (1) /weʔɬa  n-ɑx-e-ʃ kas-pasʧe-i/ ‘there-is-one + it-ends-with-it our-fingers’; (2) /n-ɑx-e-ʃ-ʧʔe na-wa  kas-pasʧe-i/ ‘it-ends-in-length- with + our-fingers’

Comment: litt. ‘it-ends-in-length-with my-toes’ (reconstructed from Schmidt’s transcription <nôjhé’ichtsena’ifjus> Max Schmidt (1940) ‘Vocabulario de la lengua Churupí’
Source: Revista de la Sociedad Científica del Paraguay V/1: 73-97
